body.p: The Action::validate() Action::validateRead() Action::validateWrite() Actually, the correct name is validate<RequestMethod>, so if the application uses custom request methods (foo for example), the validate method would be called Action::validateFoo() methods are called in addition to the defined validators for a given request method. Action::validate() is called on any request method. These methods can be used to perform complex custom validation that only happens in one place. If you have any need to reuse that validation code you should consider writing your own validator.

These methods can perform arbitrary validation logic, if they return true, the validation is successfull, if the method returns false, validation failed. The validated parameters still need to be marked as validated on the ValidationManager.
